definition: variant of 流水賬|流水账[liu2 shui3 zhang4]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: But now it refers to detailed accounts of personal expenditure.
sentences.chinese: 现在，词多用来指个人记的消费流水帐。

sentences.english: History is only the register of crimes and misfortunes .
sentences.chinese: 历史不过是罪恶与不幸的流水帐。

sentences.english: Keeping a diary as a student is not the same as a grocery store owner keeping a ledger.
sentences.chinese: 例句学生的日记不同于杂货店店主的流水帐。

sentences.english: Known as "book" books of original entry", journals provide a chronological record of all entity transactions.
sentences.chinese: 作为原始凭证，日志提供所有实体交易的流水帐。

sentences.english: I don't want to set down a series of ledgers in a diary as most people do.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿像大多数人那样在日记中记流水帐。

sentences.english: Creates journal entries when you bid, buy, post, or retrieve AH mail.
sentences.chinese: 建立一个你竞标，购买，拍卖和收到标物的流水帐。

sentences.english: Can only write a limited itemized account in next level of composition.
sentences.chinese: 只能用有限的作文水平写流水帐了。

definition: book/notebook/Japanese-style self-published comic (esp. an erotic one), aka "dōjinshi"/CL:本[ben3]/edition
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to audit accounts/to inspect accounting books
